item.title: Planning vs Preparation
item.description: You do planning to design the set of actions to achieve a goal. You do preparation to get ready for some future goal. Both are important. But the famous quote goes: “Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the mouth.” If your plans need to change during execution, the number of required modifications, and how well you carry out those modifications depend on your preparation.

item.title: Hi, I'm Kerem Kayabay
item.description: I am a researcher and developer active in data science and information systems domains. My current research is about finding ways to help transform data-disadvantaged (or underachiever) organizations to use data more effectively. Whenever I find the time, I develop open-source projects that address some of my problems. In this blog, you will find my latest findings. I also write here to clarify my thoughts. You can check out my research at Google Scholar and my projects at GitHub.
